results.title: Violin and viola
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 1 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. In this film the professional musicians show how the violin and viola are played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for them

results.title: Tuned percussion
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. Professional musicians show how each instrument of the percussion group is played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for these instruments.

results.title: Trumpet and cornet
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
Part of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. Professional musicians, Glenn Madden and Gary Foot, demonstrate how the trumpet and the cornet are played, their range and tone, and show how to care for these instruments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.

results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, Malcolm Smith, Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The problems and rewards of school teaching in country areas. Contains interviews with staff, school students and community involved with Ceduna High School in South Australia.

results.title: Tomorrow's Canberra
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Don Murray, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and The Film House
results.brief_description: Impressions of planning projects before the N.C.D.C. from a design by Chicago architect Walter Burley Griffin, with views of development in Canberra as at 1972. Shows the Commission in discussion with advisory groups about such projects as the “Parliamentary Triangle” development and Tuggeranong.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Schepisi, Don Murray, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and The Film House

results.title: Together
results.creator_credit: Denis Horn, Lorenzo Mazzetti and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: The story of two deaf mutes who work on the docks and live together in a dingy lodging house. A study in isolation - influenced by the Italian neo-realist school. One of the first films of the British ‘Free Cinema’ movement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Horn, Lorenzo Mazzetti and British Film Institute

results.title: Thrill of the surf
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s national sports vividly pictured for those who live far from an ocean beach. Shows ocean beaches along the coast of New South Wales where surfing is more popular than any other sport. Its thrills include surf-boarding, surf skiing and life-savers rowing surf boats. The lifesaving clubs which exist all along the coastline have more than 13,000 rescues to their credit to date (1949).
